Definition: Total dissolved nitrogen [nitrate + nitrite + ammonia + organic-N] reported as nitrogen. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Phosphate reported as phosphate (rather than as phosphorus). 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv". This analysis was run on a subset of sampling events (i.e. Parent ID). Data from additional sampling events (i.e. Parent_IDs) may be added in the future.

Additional notes about any of the sampling (relevant field conditions; deviations from protocol; major hydromorphic features).
Aromaticity index calculated as per Koch and Dittmar; 2006; 2016.
Modified aromaticity index calculated as per Koch and Dittmar; 2006; 2016.
Percent albite in less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
Estimated algal mat cover on riverbed. One of the following classes may be selected: full; partial; or no coverage.
Percent amphibole in less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
Percent apatite in less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Adenosine triphosphate (ATP) concentration in nanomoles per liter extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Adenosine triphosphate (ATP) extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples normalized to picomoles per gram using mass of dry sediment; mass of water in sediment; mass of ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (EDTA); and mass of reagent used in extraction. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
Average of measurements of dissolved oxygen in laboratory incubation.
Remaining sensor internal battery voltage.
Boundaries used to assign compound classes to molecular formula. Boundary sets 1 are Van Krevelen-based (Kim et al.; 2003).
Boundaries used to assign compound classes to molecular formula. Boundary sets 2 are Van Krevelen-based (Bailey et al.; 2017).
Boundaries used to assign compound classes to molecular formula. Boundary sets  3 further integrate stoichiometry to assign modified compound classes (Rivas-Urbach et al.; 2018).
Carbon atoms in the analyzed molecule. Identified by an algorithm in Kujawinski and Behn 2006 and modified as described in Tfaily et al.; 2017.
Percent calcite in less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
Calculated ionic mass for the assigned molecular formula. The units of mass to charge ratio is commonly denoted as m/z.
Ionic mass of a peak after calibration in CoreMS. The units of mass to charge ratio is commonly denoted as m/z.
Order of the polynomial function used during calibration in CoreMS (1 = linear, 2 = quadratic).
Number of calibration points used during calibration in CoreMS.
Root mean square error (RMSE) of the calibration in CoreMS.
Threshold of acceptable number of calibration points set for the automated calibration function in our CoreMS pipeline.
Estimated canopy coverage over the river only. Total riparian zone canopy cover does not apply. One of the following classes may be selected: full; partial; or no coverage.
Percent chlorite in less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
City.
City or township.
Sample name with rows representing peak intensities reflected as presence absence.
Blank sample name with rows representing peak intensities reflected as presence absence.
Date of sample collection.
Method of sample collection registered in the System for Earth Sample Registration (SESAR; https://www.geosamples.org/about/services#igsnregistration) system. Controlled vocabulary from SESAR.
Description of how sample was collected.
Name of person who collected the sample or primary contact.
Column or row headers from each tabular file (comma-separated values (.csv) or tab-separated values (.tsv)) in the dataset.
Name of study associated with sample.
Value (0-1) given by CoreMS to the assigned molecular formula with 1 being the highest confidence (e.g., approximate likelihood of being accurate).
Contact first name.
Contact last name.
Country where sample was collected.
Type of data (numeric; text; date; time; datetime).
Date.
The latest date in the file.
The earliest date in the file.
Date and time of measurement.
Double bond equivalent or degree of unsaturation calculated as per Koch and Dittmar; 2006; 2016.
Double bond equivalent or degree of unsaturation calculated as per Koch and Dittmar; 2006; 2016.
The minimum number of C-C double bonds plus rings in a common molecular structure containing heteroatoms. Calculated as per Koch and Dittmar; 2006; 2016.
Double bond equivalent minus Oxygen calculated as per Koch and Dittmar; 2006; 2016.
Description of the information in a given column or row in the dataset.
Gibbs free energy of the carbon oxidation half reaction under standard conditions (pH = 0). Calculated as  per LaRowe and Van Cappellen; 2011.
Gibbs free energy of the carbon oxidation half reaction at pH 7. Calculated as per Song et al.; 2020.
Gibbs free energy of the carbon oxidation half reaction per compound mol at pH 7. Calculated as per Song et al.; 2020.
Gibbs free energy of the carbon oxidation half reaction per compound mol at pH 0. Calculated as per Song et al.; 2020.
Depositional zone type. From provided controlled vocabulary with option to write in other terms.
Dissolved oxygen measured during in situ sensor deployment.

Standard deviation of dissolved oxygen (DO) in milligrams per liter. This calculation excludes the first 20 minutes and last 5 minutes inside the water to account for the equilibration time of the instrument for the samples that begin with "CM". Samples that begin with "SSS" are trimmed to the average time of equilibrated CM data. The dissolved oxygen data also includes an offset for instrument calibration.
Dissolved oxygen measurement taken at time zero which signifies the beginning of the sediment incubation.
Percent dolomite in less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
Sediment dry mass.

Sediment dry mass from less than 2 millimeter fraction in moisture tins (i.e. the container samples with "MOI" are in). Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
Parts per million error calculated as [expected molecular mass - measured molecular mass]/expected molecular mass * 1e6).
Value (0-1) given by CoreMS to the individual peaks that determines whether the error was acceptable with 1 being acceptable.

Dissolved organic carbon (DOC) measured as non-purgeable organic carbon (NPOC) and reported as carbon in milligrams per liter.  NPOC extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples using native, filtered water from sampling site. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Dissolved organic carbon (DOC) measured as non-purgeable organic carbon (NPOC) and reported as carbon in milligrams per kilogram. NPOC extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples using native, filtered water from sampling site. Samples were normalized to milligrams NPOC per kilogram sediment in the incubation vial using the dry mass of sediment and mass of water in the incubation vial. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Total dissolved nitrogen [nitrate + nitrite + ammonia + organic-N] reported as nitrogen in milligrams per liter.  TN extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples using native, filtered water from sampling site. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Total dissolved nitrogen [nitrate + nitrite + ammonia + organic-N] reported as nitrogen in milligrams per kilogram.  TN extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples using native, filtered water from sampling site. Samples were normalized to milligrams TN per kilogram sediment in the incubation vial using the dry mass of sediment and mass of water in the incubation vial. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Iron (II) data in milligrams per kilogram. Samples were normalized to milligrams iron (II) per kilogram sediment in the incubation vial using the dry mass of sediment and mass of water in the incubation vial. Sediment from less than 2 millimeter fraction.
Iron (II) data in milligrams per liter. Iron (II) extracted from sediment from less than 2 millimeter fraction.
Indicator of which Fibox station the incubation was performed at.
Name of field of header rows before data.
Informal classification of sample.
Name of field program or cruise registered in the System for Earth Sample Registration (SESAR; https://www.geosamples.org/about/services#igsnregistration) system.
A brief description of the files in the data package.
Name of files in the data package.
File path within the data package.

Methods information for Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry (FTICR-MS). Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
General vegetation type from provided controlled vocabulary during sediment sampling. From provided controlled vocabulary with the option to select up to 2 if mixed.
Gibbs free energy of the carbon oxidation half reaction under standard conditions. Calculated as per LaRowe and Van Cappellen; 2011.
Hydrogen atoms in the analyzed molecule. Identified by an algorithm in Kujawinski and Behn 2006 and modified as described in Tfaily et al.; 2017.
The type of heteroatoms (e.g., oxygen, nitrogen, sulfur, phosphorous) in a formula.
Hydrogen to carbon ratio.
General hydrogeomorphology of river. One of the following classes may be selected: multi-channel (braided); single-channel straight; single-channel meandering.
Link to hydrograph if available.
International Generic Sample Numbers (IGSNs) registered with System for Earth Sample Registration (SESAR; https://www.geosamples.org/about/services#igsnregistration).
Index of peak.
Free text field to describe the sensor installation/deployment design; structure; or general information.
Unique user-determined ID for a method described in the InstallationMethods_Description column in InstallationMethods.csv and listed as a metadata header row term in the data files.
Indicator of if the stream is intermittent or perennial.
Charge of the ion. This value is -1 for all  samples because we run our samples using electrospray ionization in the negative mode.
Indicates whether a formula was assigned from a given ionization category. This is always "de-protonated" because we run our samples using electrospray ionization in the negative mode.
Indicates whether a formula contains different isotopes of the same atom with 0 indicating it is not an isotopologue and 1 indicating that it is an isotopologue.
Value (0-1) given by CoreMS to evaluate whether an isotopologue matches the mono-isotopic version of the formula with 1 being the closest match.
Kendrick Defect = Nominal Kendrick Mass - Kendrick Mass; Hughey et al.; 2001.
(IUPACmass)(14/14.01565); where IUPAC mass is based on the 12C atomic mass as exactly 12 Da. Hughey et al.; 2001.
Thermodynamic efficiency (defined by lambda) at pH 7. Calculated as per Song et al.; 2020.
Thermodynamic efficiency (defined by lambda) at standard state (pH = 0). Calculated as per Song et al.; 2020.
Geographic location (latitude).
Name of field site where sample was collected.
Description of the locality.
Geographic location (longitude).
First Fibox measurement of dissolved oxygen in laboratory incubation.
Second Fibox measurement of dissolved oxygen in laboratory incubation.
Third Fibox measurement of dissolved oxygen in laboratory incubation.
Estimated macrophyte cover in the river. One of the following classes may be selected: full; partial; or no coverage.
Measured ionic mass. The units of mass to charge ration is commonly denoted as m/z.

Type of sample (e.g. Liquid>aqueous; sediment; etc.). Uses a controlled vocabulary from System for Earth Sample Registration (SESAR; https://www.geosamples.org/about/services#igsnregistration) system.

Mean dissolved nitrogen [nitrate + nitrite + ammonia + organic-N] reported as nitrogen. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_Water); the total nitrogen (TN) values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g.CM_005_TN-1; CM_005_TN-2; CMC_005_TN-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher; the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Mean phosphate reported as phosphate (rather than as phosphorus). 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_ION) the values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. CM_005_ION-1; CM_005_ION-2; CM_005_ION-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. This analysis was run on a subset of sampling events (i.e. Parent ID). Data from additional sampling events (i.e. Parent_IDs) may be added in the future. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Mean gravimetric moisture in sediment from less than 2 millimeter fraction. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_MOI) the values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. CM_005_MOI-1; CM_005_MOI-2; CM_005_MOI-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 15 percent or higher and could be confirmed using gravimetric moisture calculations from respiration incubations the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Mean nitrite reported as nitrite (rather than as nitrogen). 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_ION) the values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. CM_005_ION-1; CM_005_ION-2; CM_005_ION-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. This analysis was run on a subset of sampling events (i.e. Parent ID). Data from additional sampling events (i.e. Parent_IDs) may be added in the future. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Mean bromide. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_ION) the values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. CM_005_ION-1; CM_005_ION-2; CM_005_ION-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. This analysis was run on a subset of sampling events (i.e. Parent ID). Data from additional sampling events (i.e. Parent_IDs) may be added in the future. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Mean adenosine triphosphate (ATP) concentration in nanomoles per liter extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_ATP) the values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. CM_005_ATP-1; CM_005_ATP-2; CM_005_ATP-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher in the picomoles per gram calculation the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Mean adenosine triphosphate (ATP) extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples normalized to picomoles per gram using mass of dry sediment; mass of water in sediment; mass of ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (EDTA); and mass of reagent used in extraction. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_ATP) the values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. CM_005_ATP-1; CM_005_ATP-2; CM_005_ATP-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher in the picomoles per gram calculation the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Mean dissolved oxygen (DO) in milligrams per liter measured during in situ sensor deployment. This calculation excludes the first 20 minutes and last 5 minutes inside the water to account for the equilibration time of the instrument for the CM Data. SSS data are trimmed to the average time of equilibrated CM data. The dissolved oxygen data also includes an offset for instrument calibration.

Mean dissolved organic carbon (DOC) measured as non-purgeable organic carbon (NPOC) and reported as carbon in milligrams per liter.  NPOC extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples using native, filtered water from sampling site. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_SED) the values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. CM_005_SED-1; CM_005_SED-2; CM_005_SED-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher in the picomoles per gram calculation the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Mean dissolved organic carbon (DOC) measured as non-purgeable organic carbon (NPOC) and reported as carbon in milligrams per kilogram. NPOC extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples using native, filtered water from sampling site. Samples were normalized to milligrams NPOC per kilogram sediment in the incubation vial using the dry mass of sediment and mass of water in the incubation vial. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_SED) the values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. CM_005_SED-1; CM_005_SED-2; CM_005_SED-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher in the picomoles per gram calculation the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Mean total dissolved nitrogen [nitrate + nitrite + ammonia + organic-N] reported as nitrogen in milligrams per liter.  TN extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples using native, filtered water from sampling site. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_SED) the values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. CM_005_SED-1; CM_005_SED-2; CM_005_SED-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher in the picomoles per gram calculation the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Mean total dissolved nitrogen [nitrate + nitrite + ammonia + organic-N] reported as nitrogen in milligrams per kilogram.  TN extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples using native, filtered water from sampling site. Samples were normalized to milligrams TN per kilogram sediment in the incubation vial using the dry mass of sediment and mass of water in the incubation vial. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_SED) the values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. CM_005_SED-1; CM_005_SED-2; CM_005_SED-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher in the picomoles per gram calculation the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. Mean iron (II) data in milligrams per kilogram extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_Sediment)the iron (Fe) values of each of the three biological replicates of 10 milliliter incubations ONLY are averaged (e.g. CM_005_SFE-1; CM_005_SFE-2; CM_005_SFE-3). The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Mean iron (II) data in milligrams per liter extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_Sediment) the iron (Fe) values of each of the three biological replicates of 10 milliliter incubations ONLY are averaged (e.g. CM_005_SFE-1; CM_005_SFE-2; CM_005_SFE-3). The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
Indication of whether all replicates (reps) are included in the calculation of the mean (with a FALSE flag) or all replicates are not included (with a TRUE flag).

Mean ammonium reported as ammonium (rather than as nitrogen). For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_ION) the values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. CM_005_ION-1; CM_005_ION-2; CM_005_ION-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were identified as an outlier or were above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. Outliers were identified using distance based outlier detection. If the set of replicates had a coefficient of variation of 30 percent or higher the outlier was identified by calculating the distance between each of the replicates. The replicate with the highest distance to the other two replicates was flagged as an outlier. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv". This analysis was run on a subset of sampling events (i.e. Parent ID). Data from additional sampling events (i.e. Parent_IDs) may be added in the future.

Unit: milligrams per hour per liter sediment
Definition: Mean respiration rate normalized to volume of sediment. Variation between replicates is due to heterogeneity in samples. Therefore no outliers were removed from the mean. The calculation used to produce some of these data (theoretical respiration rates) includes assumptions that the project team has decided are appropriate; but the user should decide if using this data is appropriate for their analysis. See methods deviation codes for more detail. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Mean respiration rate. The slope of the linear regression with time on the x-axis and dissolved oxygen on the y-axis. Variation between replicates is due to heterogeneity in samples. Therefore no outliers were removed from the mean. The calculation used to produce some of these data (theoretical respiration rates) includes assumptions that the project team has decided are appropriate; but the user should decide if using this data is appropriate for their analysis. See methods deviation codes for more detail. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Mean specific surface area from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_Sediment); the specific surface area values of each of the three to five biological replicates are averaged (e.g. CM_011_SSA-1; CM_011_SSA-2; CM_011_SSA-3; CM_011_SSA-4; CM_011_SSA-5). Outliers are removed in the data file with all reps ("CM_SSS_Sediment_Specific_Surface_Area.csv"); see the methods codes for information on outlier methods. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. This analysis was run on a subset of sampling events (i.e. Parent ID). Data from additional sampling events (i.e. Parent_IDs) may be added in the future. Methods information is embedded in first few rows of respective data file with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Mean water temperature from dissolved oxygen (DO) sensor (miniDOT) in degrees Celsius measured during in situ sensor deployment. This calculation excludes the first 20 minutes and last 5 minutes inside the water to account for the equilibration time of the instrument for the CM Data. SSS data are trimmed to the average time of equilibrated CM data.

Median time (mid point) of sensor deployment time in the local time zone. The calculation of the midpoint excludes the first 20 minutes and last 5 minutes inside the water to account for the equilibration time of the instrument.

Median time (mid point) of sensor deployment time in Unix time. The calculation of the midpoint excludes the first 20 minutes and last 5 minutes inside the water to account for the equilibration time of the instrument.
Description of method code.
Alphanumeric ID associated with method code.
Instrument used in method code.
Laboratory in which methods were completed.
Name of method code category.
Type of method.

Deviations from the methods codes listed in the header rows. If a row has a methods deviation; it indicates that the sample from that row uses the methods indicated in the deviations column when they conflict with the methods written in the header rows above (MethodID_*).
Percent microcline in less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
Date of miniDOT deployment.
The time the miniDOT was removed from the water.
Geographic location (latitude) of miniDOT sensor deployment.
Geographic location (longitude) of miniDOT sensor deployment.
Free form notes about the miniDOT.
miniDOT serial number.
The time the miniDOT was deployed in the water.

Cells with missing data are represented with a missing value code rather than an empty cell. This column describes which missing value codes were used. The recommendation for numeric data is "-9999" and for character data is "N/A". Some files also use a missing value format specific to when a data value is below the limit of detection or above/below the standard curve. For these cases: a text string is included in the format "[data type]_*|*_Raw_Not_Corrected|*_Final_Corrected" in which the asterisks are the denoted individual data values. See the associated methods deviation (DTL_003) for more details.
Molecular Formula. This column is a direct output of CoreMS. "MolForm" is the same column but with spaces removed.
Molecular Formula. Same as "Molecular_Formula" column with spaces removed.
Reference to the peak index of the mono-isotopic version of an isotopologue.
Percent muscovite in less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
Nitrogen atoms in the analyzed molecule. Identified by an algorithm in Kujawinski and Behn 2006 and modified as described in Tfaily et al.; 2017.

Ammonium reported as ammonium (rather than as nitrogen). Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv". This analysis was run on a subset of sampling events (i.e. Parent ID). Data from additional sampling events (i.e. Parent_IDs) may be added in the future.

Unit: milligrams dissolved oxygen per hour per liter sediment
Definition: Respiration rate normalized to volume of sediment. The calculation used to produce some of these data (theoretical respiration rates) includes assumptions that the project team has decided are appropriate; but the user should decide if using this data is appropriate for their analysis. See methods deviation codes for more detail.
Nominal Oxidation State of Carbon calculated as per LaRowe and Van Cappellen; 2011.
Free text field to record notes related to the site visit including weather; site disturbance; or other information relevant to the quality of data collected.
Nitrogen to Carbon ratio.
Nitrogen to Phosphorous ratio.
Number of data points included in the respiration regression. See the file ending in "Methods_Codes.csv" for more details.
Number of data points removed from the respiration regression. See the file ending in "Methods_Codes.csv" for more details.
Oxygen atoms in the analyzed molecule. Identified by an algorithm in Kujawinski and Behn 2006 and modified as described in Tfaily et al.; 2017.
Organization/Institution associated with site.
Other names used for the site.
Oxygen to carbon ratio.
Phosphorous atoms in the analyzed molecule. Identified by an algorithm in Kujawinski and Behn 2006 and modified as described in Tfaily et al.; 2017.
The ID associated with the entire kit of supplies and data used by the collaborator to collect data.
The International Geo Sample Number (IGSN) for each site ID.
Area underneath an assigned peak. We do not calculate this so it is -9999 (missing value used for numeric columns).
Equivalent to peak intensity (e.g., how big is a peak).
Percent clay (calculated using 1.5 hour and 24 hour hydrometer readings).
Percent coarse sand (less than 2000 micrometers and greater than 500 micrometers).
Percent fine sand (less than 250 micrometers and greater than 53 micrometers).
Percent medium sand (less than 500 micrometers and greater than 250 micrometers).
Percent silt (calculated as 100 - (percent sand + percent clay)).
Percent total sand (calculated from sum of fine; medium; and coarse sand).
pH.
Name of the physiographic feature (stream).

Type of physical feature that sample was collected from using suggested vocabulary from System for Earth Sample Registration (SESAR; https://www.geosamples.org/about/services#igsnregistration) system. Controlled vocabulary from SESAR.
Phosphorus to Carbon ratio.
Percent pyroxene in less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
Percent quartz in less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
Related URL associated with the samples.
Type of URL associated with the samples.
Value which describes the instruments capability to distinguish a peak from a different peak given similar mass-to-charge ratios.
P value of respiration regression.
R-squared of respiration regression.
Adjusted R-squared of respiration regression.

Respiration rate. The slope of the linear regression with time on the x-axis and dissolved oxygen on the y-axis. The calculation used to produce some of these data (theoretical respiration rates) includes assumptions that the project team has decided are appropriate; but the user should decide if using this data is appropriate for their analysis. See methods deviation codes for more detail.
General gradient of river. One of the following classes may be selected: relatively flat/gentle gradient (e.g.; valleys) or relatively steep gradient (e.g.; mountainous or hilly terrain).
Sulphur atoms in the analyzed molecule. Identified by an algorithm in Kujawinski and Behn 2006 and modified as described in Tfaily et al.; 2017.
Signal-to-noise ratio.
Date of sample collection.
Geographic location (latitude) of sampling.
Geographic location (longitude) of sampling.

Name of sample. If the sample name includes the material (i.e. ##_###_Water) the row is referring to all of samples of that analysis of a given material. Individual samples follow the format of [Parent_ID]_[analysis-specific indicator code]-[replicate number] (i.e. ##_###_OCN-1). Not all sample types have replicates. See file ending in "readme.pdf" for more details.
Estimated dominant sediment type/size class of streambed. Size/type classes include gravel/cobble (>2 millimeters); sand; silt/mud (<0.0625 millimeters); or bedrock (primarily).
Depth of sediment collection.
Site ID.
Name of site.
Percent smectite in less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".

Specific surface area from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples. If the three replicates from a sampling event (e.g. CM_011_SSA-1; CM_011_SSA-2; CM_011_SSA-3) were flagged as having a coefficient of variation above 30 percent; samples were rehomogenized and subsampled for two additional replicates (e.g. CM_011_SSA-4; CM_011_SSA-5). This analysis was run on a subset of sampling events (i.e. Parent ID). Data from additional sampling events (i.e. Parent_IDs) may be added in the future.
Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format or other standard applied to the data file.
Start time of laboratory incubation.
State.
State or province where sample was collected.
Stop time of laboratory incubation.
Stream name.

Water temperature from dissolved oxygen (DO) sensor (miniDOT) in degrees Celsius measured during in situ sensor deployment. The data excludes the first 20 minutes and last 5 minutes inside the water to account for the equilibration time of the instrument for the CM Data. SSS data are trimmed to the average time of equilibrated CM data.
Fibox temperature at each measurement during incubation.

Standard deviation of water temperature calculated from the dissolved oxygen (DO) sensor measured during in situ sensor deployment. This calculation excludes the first 20 minutes and last 5 minutes inside the water to account for the equilibration time of the instrument. The dissolved oxygen data also includes an offset for instrument calibration.
Indicates whether the header is a column header or row header.
Local time zone.
Total time of laboratory sediment incubation.
Unit of measurement that applies to a given column or row in the data package.
Vertical distance between water surface and bed of sampling location.
Water mass.

Water mass in moisture tins (i.e. the container samples with "MOI" are in). Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
Weather conditions (sunny; partly cloudy; overcast; raining; other) during sample collection.
Mass of wet sediment from less than 2 millimeter fraction.

Mass of wet sediment from less than 2 millimeter fraction in moisture tins (i.e. the container samples with "MOI" are in). Methods information is embedded in first few rows with methods codes that are defined in the file that ends in "Methods_Codes.csv".
